description:
Chile suspends classes in kindergartens, municipal and charter schools from March 16 to March 27. Chile extends the suspension of classes from April 27 until sanitary conditions allow a gradual return.
 UPDATE: The suspension of classes is extended until sanitary conditions allow a gradual return.

Chile issued a Declaration of emergency (State of catastrophe) for the next 90 days starting on March 18.

Chile issued a Declaration of emergency (State of catastrophe) for the next 90 days starting on March 18. The declaration of emergency has been extended for additional 90 days. The extension starts on June 17. UPDATE: The declaration of emergency has been extended for additional 90 days.

Chile issued a Declaration of emergency (State of catastrophe) for the next 90 days on March 19. UPDATE: The declaration of emergency (state of catastrophe) issued on 03/19/2020  has been extended for additional 90 days. The extension starts from 06/16/2020.

Chile issued a Declaration of emergency (State of catastrophe) for the next 90 days starting on March 18. Chile extends the declaration of emergency until September 25 due to the celebrations of the National Holidays.
 UPDATE: The declaration of emergency was set to last until September 15, it is now extended to September 25.

Chile issued a Declaration of emergency (State of catastrophe) for the next 90 days starting on March 18. The state of emergency has been extended until December 15.
 UPDATE: The state of emergency was extended again for additional 90 days until December 15.
Chile forbids the landfall of cruise ships from March 15 to Sep. 30, 2020.

description: Chile puts first school in quarantine and updates the protocol of quarantine for educational establishments. In case a student has a direct relative with covid 19, she/he has to complete 14 day quarantine. If a student is infected with covid 19, his whole class will be quarantined. If two or more students or a employee of the school is covid-19 positive, the whole establishment will be quarantined for 14 days. This takes effect on March 13.
